Paratroopers Can Move During Non Combat
Paratroopers Can Attack Deep Into Enemy Territory
Unplaced units live when not placed
On Entering Units Destroyed Instead Of Captured
Units Can Be Destroyed Instead Of Captured
Units Can Be Changed On Capture
Blitz Through Factories And AA Restricted
Defending Suicide and Munition Units Do Not Fire

notes
property.value:
UNDER SIEGE:
Apocalypse

Version 2.5.0

The economy of the world is in turmoil!
The United States of America, against the advise of the United Nations, has continued thier development of Advance Laser Technology.
As the first tower nears compleation, many European, Asian and third world nations begin recalling their diplomats home.
Now the world waits...

Will you deploy that first laser...


Gameplay
  • When game startes there will be an initial deployment phase before turn 1 begins.
  • The Americans first places all its 60 units (24 Infantry, 9 Mechanized, 12 Armor, 9 Helicopters and 6 Bombers) when the game starts. It has to place 2 units on all of the 30 US cities.
  • Starting with Western each invader then places 20 predefined units, on its attack zones: 8 Infantry, 3 Mechanized, 4 Armor, 3 Helicopters and 2 Bombers. Each invasion zone has a unit placement limit of 5.
  • After all the invaders place their 20 units turn 1 will start. The order of play for each turn is: Western, Southern and Eastern, with the Americans playing last.
  • The turn sequence is: Develop Reinforcements/Place Reinforcements/Combat Move/Battle/Non Combat Move.

Americans Objectives
  • Americans player objective: control at least 13 cities until turn 12.
  • The Americans receive 1 Lase Tower at the beginning of each turn to place into any American controled city.
  • The Americans also have the chance to recive additional military unit by use of Technology Rolls.
  • Americans cannot move into the starting invasion zones.
Invader(s) Objectives
  • Invader player(s) objective: conquer and hold at least 18 cities at the end of the Americans turn. After which the invader will be at war with each other.
  • The invaders are not allied and can attack and take territories from one another, after a declaration of war. However, they cannot move into the others' invasion zones.
  • A Single invade is the winner by controlling 13 cities on its own.

Units (Attack/Defense/Movement/PU Cost (Count)):
  • Infantry         3/3/1/3 (24)
  • Militia            5(3)/3/1/- (-)   (Militia attack at 3 when stacked with non-militia units)
  • Mechanized    3/3/2/4 (9)     (may transport one infantry/militia with transport option)
  • Armor            5/5/2/5 (12)    (can blitz)
  • Helicopter       5/5/4/8 (9)     (may transport one infantry/militia with transport option)
  • Bomber          7/7/6/12 (6)
  • Laser Tower         0/0/0/- (-)nbsp;    (US only)
  • Strike             7/0/99/- (-)nbsp;    (US only - gains one token per laser tower)
    Reinforcements/Bids
    The American Player has a limit to the number of certain units available:
    • Infanty - 24
    • Mechanized - 9
    • Armor - 12
    • Helicopters - 9
    • Bombers - 6 These limits are suspended only during the American Bid purchase phase, which comes after the American Initial deployment phase. After the American Bid Purchase, the unit limits are again in effect.ie...
      The American Bid is 15, during the American Bid purchase the American Player may purchase 3 Armor units, at 5PUs each, giving the American Player a total of 15 Armor units.
      If during the American Reinforcement/Tech Roll phase the American Player is granted the option to purchase another Armor unit, the American Player will not be able to purchase this Armor unit unless 4 or more Armor units were lost prior to this deployment. And the chance to purchase this Armor unit is lost.
      There are 2 Game Options that can change this out come:
      1) Retain Unused American Resources: Allows the American Player the ability to keep the Armor purchase until the unit count falls below 12.
      2) Add American Reinforcements to Purchase: Which grants the American Player the Armor unit without the need to purchase it.
      And there is also the: No Reinforcement: Which all Players use only their starting units.
      Reinforcement/Bid Units are placed using the following rules:
      • The American Player may place only two units in the same territory at one time, this includes the Laser Canon, and can stack no more then 5 units in a territory.
      • Militia units can only be stacked 2 high in a single territory.
    • Strike counters will be placed in the Northern Command territory.

    The Invader Players do thier Bid purchase before their initial deployment. These extra units are added to the initial deployment, and they do not count against their total reinforcements. For their reinforcements, the Invaders have the ability to purchase between 0 and 8 units during their next 9 turns, as long as their total unit purchases does not exceed 40 units. Invader units are deployed into their 6 home invasion zones, and they can only stack 5 units in each zone.

    Cities and mountians territories: Attacker suffers a -1 penalty for attacking into these territories.
    Combined Arms: Units gain an attack benefit when attacking with different classed units:
    (Ground/Mobile/Air)
    Militia Units do not benefit from Combined Arms.

    Invasion USA Team:
    Author: Hobbes__
    Images: Dagon81
    Testing & Ideas: Pwnator
